Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; exterior: reserved band at top of foot and glazed streaky black below; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros. The number 767 is written in pencil on the underside of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 56)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1054) (phase 2)
